newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo aluminium futures end lower, tracking LME.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo aluminium futures end lower, tracking LME.

text.p: Tokyo yen-based aluminium futures finished lower on Friday, disappointed by a decline in the metal's price overnight in London, traders said.
"Volume was very small ahead of an extended holiday weekend in London and New York," said one trader.
"(Tokyo futures) will continue to be directionless in the near term, with market focus on the dollar."
In London on Thursday, aluminium crumbled, while copper futures hit a fresh one-year high and zinc went to its highest since 1992.

During Asian trade, LME three month aluminium eased further after giving up a defensive position above $1,650 overnight in London. It was quoted at $1,625/29 per tonne at 0700 GMT, compared with $1,633 at the kerb close on Thursday.
Benchmark April 1998 lost 1.9 yen to close at 193.3 yen per kg. Other contracts ranged from 0.9 to 3.3 yen lower.
Trade volume was 1,975 lots, down from 2,643 lots on Thursday.
